content.body: Hixie: "+ language, the user agent create a script, using the" -- s/user agent/user agent must/ ?
man, first you complain that i have too much rfc2119 language, and then you complain i don't have enough :-P
w3c pays more people to work on the semantic web than it pays to work on html and webapps put together -- http://www.w3.org/Member/team-effort
Hixie, there's an example in the spec for the <mark> element using a <style> element that needs a scoped attribute. http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#the-mark-element
I upgraded the whatwg blog to WordPress 2.7
well on the plus side if this OpenService idea takes off, it seems easy to implement in other browsers
oh, I haven't heard about those yet
really? they've been pimping them out for months now
I haven't paid much attention to IE
makes using IE8 a pain; every time you select somethin, a block comes up overlapping some of the text
oh, that's that crappy feature I disable as much as I can
